F260EBDB66954076BF922CF083354FE7.description:
Critically analyze how the context, structure, and history of public education in California	
affects and influences state, district, and school governance as well as state and local
education finance

B6BDD8EBE4834177A5B1060E105871FA.description:
Understand and enact	professional roles and responsibilities as mandated reporters and
comply with all laws concerning professional responsibilities, professional conduct, and
moral fitness, including the responsible use of social media	and other digital platforms and tools

A559CEA5F97B4A30B0EC0C4CC9E0BC31.description:
Demonstrate professional responsibility for all aspects of student	learning and classroom
management, including responsibility for the learning outcomes of all students, along with
appropriate concerns and policies regarding the privacy, health, and safety of students and
families. Beginning teachers conduct	themselves with integrity and model ethical conduct	
for themselves and others

63346B2B7595422AB6408720D309BB11.description:
Demonstrate how and when to involve other adults and to communicate effectively with
peers and colleagues, families, and members of the larger school community to support	
teacher and student	learning.

83B8D8CAD71B4314907F0366DFCB0028.description:
Establish professional learning goals and make progress to improve their practice by
routinely engaging in communication and inquiry with colleagues

326385C2954A4FD6B2C2EFF3A99F61B7.description:
Recognize their own values and implicit	and explicit	biases, the ways in which these values
and implicit	and explicit	biases may positively and negatively affect	teaching and learning,
and work to mitigate any negative impact	on the teaching and learning of students. They
exhibit	positive dispositions of caring, support, acceptance, and fairness toward all students
and families, as well as toward their colleagues.

5C3D2C81F2B946E9B92AB2D5D87FA97E.description:
Reflect	on their own teaching practice and level of subject	matter and pedagogical
knowledge to plan and implement	instruction that	can improve student	learning.

5B0DDF104503488A93C1F7C90524A0EE.description:
Use assessment	data, including information from students' IEP, IFSP, ITP, and 504 plans, to
establish learning goals and to plan, differentiate, make accommodations and/or modify
instruction

BDC43E65FB4A47FC972B9C108BC7DFC0.description:
Interpret	English learners' assessment	data	to identify their level of academic proficiency in
English as well as in their primary language, as applicable, and use this information in
planning instruction

7C6DB112B1D84466BEEF1F41037FD425.description:
Work with specialists to interpret	assessment	results from formative and summative
assessments to distinguish between students whose first	language is English, English
learners, Standard English learners, and students with language or other disabilities.

F785BB0F6A5943F5A9CA7CFC9A4C7FB0.description:
Use assessment	information in a	timely manner to assist	students and families in
understanding student	progress in meeting learning goals.

A8F882F65D8545DEADE72B8CA8D20785.description:
Use technology as appropriate to support	assessment	administration, conduct	data	analysis,
and communicate learning outcomes to students and families

D85D8BB264E64602875C166E8B444212.description:
Involve all students in self-assessment	and reflection on their learning goals and progress
and provide students with opportunities to revise or reframe their work based on
assessment	feedback

75CC8660ABE74EB2B4A5F2D3C52364E0.description:
Collect	and analyze assessment	data	from multiple measures and sources to plan and
modify instruction and document	students' learning over time.

268B592DCE5B47438BA5A0CFCA6A1B99.description:
Apply knowledge of the purposes, characteristics, and appropriate uses of different	types of
assessments (e.g., diagnostic, informal, formal, progress-monitoring, formative, summative,
and performance) to design and administer classroom assessments, including use of scoring
rubrics.

42911CFF96A14C22A0CBCF75DEC08A0E.description:
Use	digital tools and learning technologies across learning environments as appropriate to
create new content	and provide personalized and integrated technology-rich lessons to
engage students in learning, promote digital literacy, and offer students multiple means to demonstrate their learning

115CB2D4DE944A4D89F1181D05ED1209.description:
Plan instruction that	promotes a	range of communication strategies and activity modes
between teacher and student	and among students that	encourage student	participation in
learning

E8E502E871CD4D588506C964A0B43571.description:
Access resources for planning and instruction, including the expertise of community and
school colleagues through in-person	or	virtual collaboration, co-teaching, coaching, and/or
networking

CC6A79240F8145CD97B8F7049DD0023D.description:
Promote student	success by providing opportunities for students to understand and
advocate for strategies that	meet	their individual learning needs and assist	students with
specific learning needs to successfully participate in transition plans (e.g., IEP, IFSP, ITP, and
504 plans.)

DD4F1C7EB1B44531AA99092FD130B427.description:
Design and implement	instruction and assessment	that	reflects the interconnectedness of
academic content	areas and related student	skills development	in literacy, mathematics,
science, and other disciplines across the curriculum, as applicable to the subject	area	of
instruction

C75C8F30388746EEACA7E88EAD4F9AEE.description:
Understand and apply knowledge of the range and characteristics of typical and atypical
child development	from birth through adolescence to help inform instructional planning
and learning experiences for all students.

AED7F8292ABD43549AADB0F9FBF99861.description:
Locate and apply information about	students' current	academic status, content- and
standards-related learning needs and goals, assessment	data, language proficiency status,
and cultural background for both short-term and long-term instructional planning purposes.

A5D108C70C3F42F9AA1397C3CBDB2165.description: Planning Instruction and Designing Learning Experiences for All Students

61D3E544F36345349DA5582271CD640B.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of effective teaching strategies aligned with the internationally
recognized educational technology standards.

793818CDD0E44E0FB218E94A02E278EB.description:
Model and develop digital literacy by using technology to engage students and support	their
learning, and promote digital citizenship, including respecting copyright	law, understanding
fair use guidelines and the use of Creative Commons license, and maintaining Internet security

0A96C63B58A2416E9D3F3323855CAC9E.description:
Use and adapt	resources, standards-aligned instructional materials, and a	range of
technology, including assistive technology, to facilitate students' equitable access to the
curriculum

1E5D62F87C694B99A81D7DEE528E166D.description:
Adapt	subject	matter curriculum, organization, and planning to support	the acquisition and
use of academic language within learning activities to promote the subject	matter
knowledge of all students, including the full range of English learners, Standard English
learners, students with disabilities, and students with other learning needs in the least	
restrictive environment.

C3D80C037E9342F5901CEF04278C91BC.description:
Individually and through consultation and collaboration with other educators and members
of the larger school community, plan for effective subject	matter instruction and use
multiple means of representing, expressing, and engaging students to demonstrate their
knowledge

492ED01A33F2437D8B743A3B2BA757FD.description:
Plan, design, implement, and monitor instruction consistent	with current	subject-specific	
pedagogy in the content	area(s) of instruction, and design and implement	disciplinary and
cross-disciplinary learning sequences, including integrating the visual and performing arts as
applicable to the discipline

FB57FC5B99F340C699D6B6137CBE0208.description:
Use knowledge about	students and learning goals to organize the curriculum to facilitate
student	understanding of subject	matter, and make accommodations and/or modifications
as needed to promote student	access to the curriculum

C3B3F3AA5C6441C1ACAC428882B35BB3.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of subject	matter, including the adopted California	State Standards
and curriculum frameworks

ACE325C2429F407F851B386A8B34B94F.description: Understanding and Organizing Subject Matter for Student Learning

0B2144E3CD314BE9BC38CC90B4FF3AA3.description:
Establish and maintain clear expectations for positive classroom behavior and for studentto-student	and student-to-teacher interactions by communicating classroom routines,
procedures, and norms to students and families.

F13B862C20034FE685C48E511E83C10A.description:
Maintain high expectations for learning with appropriate support	for the full range of
students in the classroom

C78C600411F24C5E8156616DD8076C51.description:
Know how to access resources to support	students, including those who have experienced
trauma, homelessness, foster care, incarceration, and/or are medically fragile.

11BAAF4D5FE54FB38DDC7B0F0936CD5D.description:
Establish, maintain, and monitor inclusive learning environments that	are physically,
mentally, intellectually, and emotionally healthy and safe to enable all students to learn,
and recognize and appropriately address instances of intolerance and harassment	among
students, such as bullying, racism, and sexism

D7E4A40EEFE647D4889B931355DBE869.description:
Create learning environments (i.e., traditional, blended, and online) that	promote
productive student	learning, encourage positive interactions among students, reflect	
diversity and multiple perspectives, and are culturally responsive

3ADF9F9A6BF348E3817E3C44A8CAC2B9.description:
Promote students' social-emotional growth, development, and individual responsibility
using positive interventions and supports, restorative justice, and conflict	resolution
practices to foster a	caring community where each student	is treated fairly and respectfully
by adults and peers

88FE8E4B018249AEAD4753AF6033DEDB.description: Creating and Maintaining Effective Environments for Student Learning

C65F9FB1663448AD96511E0874F43FF8.description:
Monitor student	learning and adjust	instruction while teaching so that	students continue to
be actively engaged in learning.

4CC56770BE004F2BA5182DC3EB7B372B.description:
Provide students with opportunities to access the curriculum by incorporating the visual
and performing arts, as appropriate to the content	and context	of learning

18394F690DE94652898105F3BE760868.description:
Provide a	supportive learning environment	for students' first	and/or second language
acquisition by using research-based instructional approaches, including focused English
Language Development, Specially Designed Academic Instruction in English (SDAIE),
scaffolding across content	areas, and structured English immersion, and demonstrate an
understanding of the difference among students whose only instructional need is to acquire
Standard English proficiency, students who may have an identified disability affecting their
ability to acquire Standard English proficiency, and students who may have both a	need to
acquire Standard English proficiency and an identified disability

E7B1F8E609264C6A9B8698938C7009F3.description:
Promote students' critical and creative thinking and analysis through activities that	provide
opportunities for inquiry, problem solving, responding to and framing meaningful questions,
and reflection

FD4E111D14264FC2AAF3FEF709F80D0E.description:
Use a	variety of developmentally and ability-appropriate instructional strategies, resources,
and assistive technology, including principles of Universal Design of Learning (UDL) and
Multi-Tiered System of Supports (MTSS) to support	access to the curriculum for a	wide
range of learners within the general education classroom and environment

F7FC2F38DFD84965A1B8C400AFF068FC.description:
Connect	subject	matter to real-life contexts and provide active learning experiences to
engage student	interest, support	student	motivation, and allow students to extend their
learning.

99C8AE781C7F49358E6CB25DAFACFD14.description:
Maintain ongoing communication with students and families, including the use of
technology to communicate with and support	students and families, and to communicate
achievement	expectations and student	progress.

5D4344BDB1014AE0948BB974AF99A2F5.description:
Apply knowledge of students, including their prior experiences, interests, and socialemotional learning needs, as well as their funds of knowledge and cultural, language, and
socioeconomic backgrounds, to engage them in learning

3D10FA2F8B264A459ABC61E200794ABE.description: Engaging and Supporting All Students in Learning
